alert.note: Alert for Yell (Arkansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 02 at 11:24AM CST until March 06 at 11:27AM CST by NWS Little Rock
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Arkansas... Petit Jean River At Danville affecting Yell County. ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers in Arkansas... Fourche Lafave River Near Houston affecting Perry County. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT FROM FRIDAY EVENING TO LATE MONDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Petit Jean River At Danville. * WHEN...From Friday evening to late Monday morning. * IMPACTS...At 22.0 feet, Agricultural lands along the river are flooded. Portions of Corinth Road, north of Danville, become flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CST Thursday the stage was 15.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage late Friday evening, March 3rd, rising to a crest of 23.6 feet early Saturday afternoon, the 4th. It will then fall below flood stage early Sunday morning, the 5th. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. && Fld Observed Forecast 12 PM Crest Location Stg Stg Day/Time Fri Sat Sun Crest Time Date Petit Jean River Danville 20.0 15.0 Thu 10 AM 14.2 23.6 19.7 23.6 12 PM 3/04 &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. River forecasts are based on current conditions and rainfall forecasted to occur over the next 24 hours. During periods of flooding...Evening forecasts are reissued with updated rainfall forecasts. Observed and forecasted stage data plots are available on our Advanced Hydrologic Prediction Service web page at... www.weather.gov/lzk Under the Current Conditions section...Select River and Lakes AHPS.
